results.title: Design for irrigation. [Parts 1 & 2]
results.brief_description: Shows that a proper plan of irrigation is essential when planting new orchads. The example in the film is a new block of slightly sloping land which is to be planted with fruit trees. A model of the block shows the contours, and the method of ploughing, irrigation and planing which should be carried out in relation to the contour lines.

results.title: Design for disaster
results.creator_credit: Cinematography Unit, LA City Fire Department and William Miller
results.brief_description: In 1959 brush fires in the Los Angeles forest area made fire officers describe the region as being a “design for disaster”. This film shows the fire in November 1961 which destroyed 250 homes, without loss of life. It explains its causes and tries to suggest possible remedies.

results.title: Design for climate
results.creator_credit: Building Research and Development Advisory Committee, S.T. Evans and Nicholas Alexander
results.brief_description: Research on problems of building design for Australian conditions. Maintaining an acceptable indoor climate by economic means involves a building of suitable thermal characteristics using insulation and heating and cooling as required, proper lighting and ventilation. The noise problem, protection of external surfaces and relating the building to its environment for best use of the natural climate are considered.

results.title: Design counsel
results.creator_credit: Industrial Design Council of Australia and R. Barrington-Scott
results.brief_description: The significance of industrial design in Australian industry. Two design projects, on a portable television set and a school case, show how the designer relates production and marketing problems to consumer needs.

results.title: Design and the engineer
results.brief_description: Designed to encourage young people to follow a career in engineering design. Sets out to show the salient points and features in the field of design work, stressing the importance of the designer’s creative contribution towards helping to solve present-day economic and environmental problems.

results.title: Desert victory
results.creator_credit: Army Film Photographic Unit, Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Production Unit, David Macdonald and Roy Boulting
results.brief_description: The story of the British Eighth Army’s victory at El Alamein, and its advance commencing on 23rd October, 1942 across nearly 1,400 miles of desert in 80 days to Tripoli. The film begins in the days when Generals Alexander and Montgomery took command. The disposition of the opposed forces and the strategy of both sides are explained by means of diagram. After the break-through at El Alamein the camera follows the advance through Mersa Matruh, Halfaya Pass, Sollum, Tobruk, Benghazi, and El Agheila, to the victory parade in Tripoli. Commentary written by J.L. Hodson. (Awards: Academy award, 1943 Best Documentary)

results.title: Desert storm: the war begins
results.creator_credit: Cable News Network and Stacy Jolna
results.brief_description: This video links CNN news coverage together to tell the compelling tale of the opening chapter of the Persian Gulf War. CNN’s ‘Special Report’ team examines the leaders, the warriors, the diplomatic ploys, the history, and the battle strategems in the early days of the war.
results.description: This video links CNN news coverage together to tell the compelling tale of the opening chapter of the Persian Gulf War. CNN’s ‘Special Report’ team examines the leaders, the warriors, the diplomatic ploys, the history, and the battle strategems in the early days of the war.

results.title: Desert storm: the victory
results.creator_credit: Cable News Network and Stacy Jolna
results.brief_description: This video from CNN’s ‘Special Reports’ team documents the Persian Gulf War. It examines the failed peacemaking process, military strategy, and combat - the air war, 100-hour ground war and the liberation of Kuwait. The celebration and homecoming of the allied forces are also examined.

results.title: Desert stories (A)
results.creator_credit: KOKO P, Channel 0-28, Nick Frazer and Lindsay Frazer
results.brief_description: The Pintubi Aboriginal people of the Northern Territory tell stories of the Dreamtime, and other stories of their lives. Also shows the work of the Papunya Aboriginal Settlement Literature Production Centre in recording the Pintubi people in their own language. Care is taken that the oral tradition is retained, when transcribing the stories.
